\bigskip{}
\textbf{\Large{Education}} \smallskip \hrule \medskip

{\bf PhD in Electrical and Computer Engineering} \hfill {05/2003 \textendash{} 12/2009} \\
Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA \\
\emph{Dissertation:} Support Vector Classification Analysis of Resting State Functional Connectivity fMRI \\
\emph{Specializations:} MR Physics, Bioengineering, and Digital Signal Processing \\
\emph{Minor:} Mathematics \\
\emph{Advisors:} Xiaoping Hu, PhD and Helen Mayberg, MD \\

{\bf MS in Electrical and Computer Engineering} \hfill {01/2001 \textendash{} 05/2003} \\
Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA \\
\emph{Specializations:} Bioengineering and Digital Signal Processing \\
\emph{Minor:} Mathematics \\
\emph{Advisor:} Linda Wills, PhD \\

{\bf Bachelor of Computer Engineering} \hfill {06/1995 \textendash{} 08/1999} \\
Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA \\
\emph{Specializations:} Telecommunications and Digital Signal Processing \\

\emph{Principle Investigator:} R. Cameron Craddock, PhD \\

%\newpage{}

\emph{Principle Investigator:} R. Cameron Craddock, PhD \\
\emph{Mentors:} Stephen LaConte, PhD and Helen Mayberg, MD \\

\emph{Support Period:} 01/2011 \textendash{} 01/2013 \\
\emph{Funding Amount:} \$60,000 USD \\

\bigskip{}
\textbf{\Large{Open Science}} \smallskip \hrule \medskip

\textcolor{richorange}{[Open Source]} Configurable Pipeline for the Analysis of Connectomes \\
A python-based open source software package for performing connectivity analyses using functional MRI data on high-performance computing architectures.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://fcp-indi.github.io}{http://fcp-indi.github.io}\\
\emph{Role:} Project Director, Co-Principal Investigator\\

\textcolor{richorange}{[Open Source]} OpenCogLab Repository \\
Repository of free and open source implementations of computerized experiments for assessing human cognition.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://opencoglabrepository.github.io/}{http://opencoglabrepository.github.io/}\\
\emph{Role:} Principle Investigator, Contributor\\

\textcolor{richorange}{[Open Source]} pyClusterROI \\
An open source python library for parcellating functional MRI data using spatially constrained normalized-cut spectral clustering.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://ccraddock.github.io/cluster_roi}{http://ccraddock.github.io/cluster\_roi}\\
\emph{Role:} Primary Developer\\

\textcolor{richorange}{[Open Source]} The Preprocessed Connectomes Project Quality Assessment Protocol \\
An open source python library for estimating several different quality measures from functional and structural MRI data.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://preprocessed-connectomes-project.github.io/quality-assessment-protocol/}{http://preprocessed-connectomes-project.github.io/quality-assessment-protocol/}\\
\emph{Role:} Principle Investigator, Developer\\

\textcolor{richblue}{[Data Sharing]} The Enhanced Rockland Sample Neurofeedback Study Dataset \\
A neuroimaging database of 180 adults (21--45 years old, 50\% female) with a variety of clinical and sub-clinical psychiatric symptoms performing a variety of tasks for assessing the default mode network.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://fcon_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/enhanced/}{http://fcon\_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/enhanced/}\\
\emph{Role:} Principle Investigator\\

\textcolor{richblue}{[Data Sharing]} Intrinsic Brain Activity Test-Retest Dataset \\
This dataset consists of two ten-minute resting state fMRI scans and two multi source interference task fMRI scans acquired during the same scanning session for thirty-six adults (20--48 years old). 14 of the participants returned for a second scanning session using the same scanning procedures.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://fcon_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/CoRR/html/ibatrt.html}{http://fcon\_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/CoRR/html/ibatrt.html}\\
\emph{Role:} Contributor\\

\textcolor{richblue}{[Data Sharing]} The Enhanced Rockland Sample Dataset \\
A database of deep phenotyping and a comprehensive connectome neuroimaging assessment on individuals with a variety of clinical and sub-clinical psychiatric symptoms from across the lifespan.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://fcon_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/enhanced/}{http://fcon\_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/enhanced/}\\
\emph{Role:} Co-Investigator and Contributor\\

%\newpage
\textcolor{richblue}{[Data Sharing]} ADHD-200 Preprocessed Data \\
Preprocessed functional and structural data for 374 children and adolescents who suffer from ADHD and 598 typically developing controls from the ADHD-200 sample. Data was processed using three different software pipelines.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://neurobureau.projects.nitrc.org/ADHD200/Introduction.html}{http://neurobureau.projects.nitrc.org/ADHD200/Introduction.html}\\
\emph{Role:} Co-Principle Investigator, Contributor\\

\textcolor{richblue}{[Data Sharing]} ABIDE Preprocessed Data \\
Preprocessed functional and structural data for 539 individuals suffering from autism and 573 typical controls from the ABIDE dataset. Data was processed using four different functional processing pipelines and three different structural processing pipelines.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://preprocessed-connectomes-project.github.io/abide/}{http://preprocessed-connectomes-project.github.io/abide/}\\
\emph{Role:} Co-Principle Investigator, Contributor\\

\textcolor{richblue}{[Data Sharing]} The Neurofeedback Skull-stripped (NFBS) repository \\
A database of 125 manually skull-stripped T1-weighted anatomical MRI scans from the the Enhanced Rockland Sample Neurofeedback Study.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://preprocessed-connectomes-project.org/NFB_skullstripped/index.html}{http://preprocessed-connectomes-project.org/NFB\_skullstripped/index.html}\\
\emph{Role:} Principle Investigator, Contributor\\

\textcolor{richblue}{[Data Sharing]} The Healthy Brain Network Serial Scanning Initiative \\
A database of 13 adult participants that were repeatedly scanned under each of four scan conditions across 12 sessions. The specific conditions varied respect to level of engagement, and included: 1) resting state, 2) naturalistic viewing of a sequence of abstract shapes, 3) naturalistic viewing of highly engaging movies and 4) performance of an active task.\\
\emph{Address:} \href{http://fcon_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/hbn_ssi/}{http://fcon\_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/hbn\_ssi/}\\
\emph{Role:} Co-Investigator\\
